post.description: An operation to get the current state of the previously submitted LCM request
An operation to attach a cinder volume to a VM
An operation to audit the configurations of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to check VNF lock status
An operation to Backup configurations of a virtual network function\n(or VM)
An operation to Delete backup configurations of a virtual network\nfunction (or VM)
An operation to Export configurations of a virtual network function\n(or VM)

Use the ModifyConfig command when a full configuration cycle is either not required
or is considered too costly. The ModifyConfig LCM action affects only a subset of the
total configuration data of a VNF. The set of configuration parameters to be affected
is a subset of the total configuration data of the target VNF type. The payload Stop
Application must contain the configuration parameters to be modified and their values.
A successful modify returns a success response. A failed modify returns a failure
response and the specific failure messages in the response payload Stop Application
An operation to restore the configurations of a virtual network\nfunction (or VM)
An operation to Modify the configuration or other action to support\na ConfigScaleOut of a VNF.
An operation to configure the configurations of a virtual network\nfunction (or VM)
An operation to detach a cinder volume from a VM
An operation to evacuate a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to perform health check of vSCP prior its upgrading
An operation to perform upgrade of vSCP
An operation to perform VNF lock operation
An operation to migrate a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to query the status of a targe VNF.\nReturns information on each VM, including state (active or standby)\nand status (healthy or unhealthy)
An operation to stop traffic gracefully on the VF.\nIt stops traffic gracefully without stopping the application
An operation to reboot a specified virtual machine (VM)
An operation to rebuild a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to restart a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to resume traffic gracefully on the VF.\nIt resumes traffic gracefully without stopping the application
An operation to rollback to particular snapshot of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to create a snapshot of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to upload a new version of vSCP image to vSCP for updating it
An operation to start a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to perform VNF Start Application operation
An operation to stop the configurations of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to Stop Application traffic to a virtual network function
An operation to sync the configurations of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to terminate the configurations of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to test the configurations of a virtual network function (or VM)
An operation to perform VNF unlock operation
An operation does a backout after an UpgradeSoftware is completed (either successfully or unsuccessfully).
An operation to do full backup of the VNF data prior to an upgrade.
An operation to check the VNF upgrade has been successful completed and all processes are running properly.
An operation to check that the VNF has the correct software version needed for a software upgrade.
An operation to upgrade the target VNF to a new version and expected that the VNF is in a quiesced status .

LCM:action-identifiers.description: A block containing the action arguments. These are used to specify\nthe object upon which APP-C LCM command is to operate

LCM:common-header.description: A common header for all APP-C requests
A common header for all APP-C requests

LCM:status.description: The specific response codes are to be aligned with SDC reference doc\n(main table removed to avoid duplication and digression from main table).\nSee SDC and ECOMP Distribution Consumer Interface Agreement

LCM:action-identifiers.description: A block containing the action arguments. These are used to specify\nthe object upon which APP-C LCM command is to operate

LCM:common-header.description: A common header for all APP-C requests
A common header for all APP-C requests

LCM:locked.description: TRUE/FALSE - returns TRUE when the given VNF was locked, otherwise returns FALSE

LCM:status.description: The specific response codes are to be aligned with SDC reference doc\n(main table removed to avoid duplication and digression from main table).\nSee SDC and ECOMP Distribution Consumer Interface Agreement

service-instance-id.description:
identifies a specific service the command refers to. When multiple
   APP-C instances are used and applied to a subset of services,
   this will become significant . The field is mandatory when the
   vnf-id is empty

vf-module-id.description: identifies the VF module to which this action is to be applied.

vnf-id.description:
identifies the VNF to which this action is to be applied(vnf-id
   uniquely identifies the service-instance referred to). Note that
   some actions are applied to multiple VNFs in the same service.
   When this is the case, vnf-id may be left out, but service-instance-id
   must appear. The field is mandatory when service-instance-id is
   empty

vnfc-name.description:
identifies the VNFC to which this action is to be applied. Some
   actions apply only to a component within a VNF (e.g. RESTART is
   sometimes applied to on VM only). In such a case, the name of
   the VNFC is used to search for the component within the VNF

vserver-id.description: identifies a specific VM within the given service/vnf to which\n   this action is to be applied

api-ver.description: api-ver is the API version identifier. A given release of APPC\n   should support all previous versions of APPC API (correlate with\n   general requirements)

originator-id.description:
originator-id an identifier of the calling system which can be
   used addressing purposes, i.e. returning asynchronous response
   to the proper destination over DMaaP (especially in case of multiple
   consumers of APP-C APIs)

request-id.description:
UUID for the request ID. An OSS/BSS identifier for the request
   that caused the current action. Multiple API calls may be made
   with the same request-id The request-id shall be recorded throughout
   the operations on a single request

sub-request-id.description: Uniquely identifies a specific LCM action. It is persistent over\n   the life-cycle of a single request

timestamp.description: timestamp is in ISO 8601 timestamp format ZULU offset

force.description: TRUE/FALSE - Execute action even if target is in unstable (i.e.\n       locked, transiting, etc.) state

mode.description: EXCLUSIVE (accept no queued requests on this VNF while processing)\n       or NORMAL (queue other requests until complete)

ttl.description: <0....N> -Â The timeout value (expressed in seconds) for action\n       execution, between action being received by APPC and action initiation

LCM:service-instance-id.description:
identifies a specific service the command refers to. When multiple
   APP-C instances are used and applied to a subset of services,
   this will become significant . The field is mandatory when the
   vnf-id is empty

LCM:vf-module-id.description: identifies the VF module to which this action is to be applied.

LCM:vnf-id.description:
identifies the VNF to which this action is to be applied(vnf-id
   uniquely identifies the service-instance referred to). Note that
   some actions are applied to multiple VNFs in the same service.
   When this is the case, vnf-id may be left out, but service-instance-id
   must appear. The field is mandatory when service-instance-id is
   empty

LCM:vnfc-name.description:
identifies the VNFC to which this action is to be applied. Some
   actions apply only to a component within a VNF (e.g. RESTART is
   sometimes applied to on VM only). In such a case, the name of
   the VNFC is used to search for the component within the VNF

LCM:vserver-id.description: identifies a specific VM within the given service/vnf to which\n   this action is to be applied

LCM:action-identifiers.description: A block containing the action arguments. These are used to specify\nthe object upon which APP-C LCM command is to operate

LCM:api-ver.description: api-ver is the API version identifier. A given release of APPC\n   should support all previous versions of APPC API (correlate with\n   general requirements)

LCM:flags.description: Flags are generic flags that apply to any and all commands, all are optional

LCM:originator-id.description:
originator-id an identifier of the calling system which can be
   used addressing purposes, i.e. returning asynchronous response
   to the proper destination over DMaaP (especially in case of multiple
   consumers of APP-C APIs)

LCM:request-id.description:
UUID for the request ID. An OSS/BSS identifier for the request
   that caused the current action. Multiple API calls may be made
   with the same request-id The request-id shall be recorded throughout
   the operations on a single request

LCM:sub-request-id.description: Uniquely identifies a specific LCM action. It is persistent over\n   the life-cycle of a single request

LCM:timestamp.description: timestamp is in ISO 8601 timestamp format ZULU offset

LCM:common-header.description: A common header for all APP-C requests

LCM:status.description: The specific response codes are to be aligned with SDC reference doc\n(main table removed to avoid duplication and digression from main table).\nSee SDC and ECOMP Distribution Consumer Interface Agreement

LCM:force.description: TRUE/FALSE - Execute action even if target is in unstable (i.e.\n       locked, transiting, etc.) state

LCM:mode.description: EXCLUSIVE (accept no queued requests on this VNF while processing)\n       or NORMAL (queue other requests until complete)

LCM:ttl.description: <0....N> -Â The timeout value (expressed in seconds) for action\n       execution, between action being received by APPC and action initiation

LCM:flags.description: Flags are generic flags that apply to any and all commands, all are optional
